alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 7:18PM CDT until July 14 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Barry County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 718 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pierce City to 8 miles southwest of Wheaton to 6 miles west of Anderson, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Table Rock Lake, Roaring River State Park, Monett, Cassville, Shell Knob, Purdy, Seligman, Exeter, Wheaton, Butterfield, Washburn, Golden, Emerald Beach, Eagle Rock, Pioneer, Chain-O-Lakes, Arrow Point, Wheelerville, Jenkins and Wayne. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
